Interface UnappliedFund

  • All Superinterfaces:

    public interface UnappliedFund
extends com.guidewire.bc.domain.accounting.gen.UnappliedFundStubI, com.guidewire.bc.domain.fundstracking.impl.FundsSource, com.guidewire.bc.domain.fundstracking.impl.FundsUse
    An default unapplied or designated unapplied and set of associated invoice streams for the purposes of being able separate cash buckets

    • Method Detail

      • getBalance

        MonetaryAmount getBalance()
        Returns:
        The balance of the unapplied t-account that this UnappliedFund is holding

      • isDefaultForAccount

        boolean isDefaultForAccount()
        Returns:
        The display name of this UnappliedFund in the context of showing whether it is DefaultUnapplied or a designated unapplied, as opposed to the default which shows the account's display name if it is an DefaultUnapplied

      • getTransactionSpecialDisplayName

        java.lang.String getTransactionSpecialDisplayName()
        Returns:
        The display name of this UnappliedFund in the context of a transaction

      • getTAccountShortDisplayName

        java.lang.String getTAccountShortDisplayName()
        Returns:
        The short display name of the T-account associated with this Unapplied Fund. Note: default unapplied funds will return the default t-account display name.

      • getAvailableForDisbursement

        MonetaryAmount getAvailableForDisbursement()
        Returns the amount available for disbursement for an unapplied t-account (passed in via UnappliedFunds), which depends on the AvailableDisbAmtType (field on BillingPlan). If the type is "UnappliedMinusAUC", then this is unapplied - remaining balance. If the type is "UnappliedMinusBilled", then this is unapplied - max(0, (billed + due)).
        Returns:
        amount available for disbursement

      • getPendingDisbursementAmount

        MonetaryAmount getPendingDisbursementAmount()
        Returns:
        MonetaryAmount Returns the amount of money that has been allocated for disbursement already for the designated unapplied. This is the sum of the amount field on all disbursements on this account with status approved or awaiting approval.

      • getNextPlannedInvoice

        AccountInvoice getNextPlannedInvoice()
        Returns:
        account invoice

      • allotAllFunds

        void allotAllFunds()
        Allots funds for funds tracking from the unapplied fund's fundsSourceTrackers to the unapplied fund's fundsUseTrackers which are unallotted or partially unallotted.

      • getFundsSourceTrackers

        java.util.List<FundsSourceTracker> getFundsSourceTrackers()
        Returns:
        The fund source trackers for this unapplied fund

      • getFundsUseTrackers

        java.util.List<FundsUseTracker> getFundsUseTrackers()
        Returns:
        The fund use trackers for this unapplied fund

      • makeAdjustment

        AccountAdjustment makeAdjustment(MonetaryAmount adjustment)
        makeAdjustment() should be used when an account has excess funds in an unapplied fund that should simply go away. For example, a dummy account may be set up to temporarily hold mis-allocated funds that are being stored in BillingCenter simply for the purposes of recording the mis-allocation to the General Ledger system. In this case, funds will be transferred to the dummy accounts, integration code will post the information to the General Ledger system, and finally the funds will be adjusted using this API method. If the Adjustment amount is more than the unapplied amount of the given account, only the unapplied amount will be adjusted. The adjustment will be made in the form of a transaction, not a charge Comment: This functions like a Negative Writeoff.
        Parameters:
        adjustment - Adjustment amount (must be less than zero)
        Returns:
        AccountAdjustment transaction
